cells.data:
Techinical Problem

0. What are your biggest challenges as a front-end web developer?

    1. Coding Javascript in a robust way. Backend software is evolved like PHP and Java ,they are relatively easy to create good, maintainable code there by using MVC and mature CMS's. With Javascript, I wouldn't say that it's as easy, You need to put more effort into making sure all Javascript is working in all browsers and that new code is written and placed in a maintainable way.
    2. Cross Browser Support. For ex.Chrome supports input type number ,while firefox has not yet implemented it.
     3. Layout Engine Softwares are different for different browsers. Ex.webkit(chrome),Gecko(firefox).
     4. Client Window sizes,your UI should be intact for all Screen Resolutions.
     5. Having to learn new and complex topics. Just recently, with the trend of Responsive Web Design, LESS & SASS CSS preprocessors and much more, it's become harder for the beginners to keep up.

2.Difference between UDP and TCP  
TCP is connection oriented – once a connection is established, data can be sent bidirectional. UDP is a simpler, connectionless Internet protocol. 

3.Singleton
the singleton pattern is a design pattern that restricts the instantiation of a class to one object. 
This is useful when exactly one object is needed to coordinate actions across the system. 

A mutex provides mutual exclusion, either producer or consumer can have the key (mutex) and proceed with their work. As long as the buffer is filled by producer, the consumer needs to wait, and vice versa
A semaphore is a generalized mutex.

Behavior Question

1. most interesting problem you solved; 

Let me think, I think the most interesting problem I solved is one of  a algorithm problem, which call dungeon game,
In this algorithm problem, The demons had captured the princess  and imprisoned her in the bottom-right corner of a dungeon, and the dungeon is a 2D matrix, and our task goal is find a way from top-left matrix to  through the dungeon to rescue the princess. I spend a long time to think how to solved this problem from a programming view, , and finally I I use dynamic programming algorithm to tackle  this problem.Since this problem give me a feeling I was like really solve the realistic world thing, so I thinkg it’s pretty interesting.

2. mistake you made before; 
I think the worst mistake I ever made at work was in my first internship, I was given a project to complete in a week.  I understood the project, but I misinterpreted one section.  After completing the project, I was told by my manager that it was done incorrectly.  I really made a mistake by assuming incorrectly in one of the sections instead of asking for clarification.  From this mistake, I learned not to assume through the mistake I made."

3. how do you handle relationship with colleagues
At first  communicate effectively is very important because I think the foundation of every good relationship is solid communication. we also need  to know our co-worker.Since one of the best ways to build positive relationships is to make time to learn about people.We should Be reliable and have a positive attitude, sometimes we need to Cope with conflict. That’s  how I usuallly handle relationship with colleagues

4.How do you expect salary
 You know I am a fresher. Salary is not first priority for me. I just wanna a  big Platform to start my career and I also want to improve my Knowledge and skill and gain experience. So I expect a considerable according to my ability and your company normal standard which can fulfill my economical needs.If I need to say a exactly number, maybe nighty thousands

5.Do you know Adobe?

Adobe is more than Photoshop and PDF.  I notice that adobe  are aggressively pursuing two huge growth areas,like  Digital Media and Digital Marketing. Over the past 2 years, Adobe have steadily made acquisitions and expanded focus into new areas that are very different from adobe history. And you know I like  many Adobe products, like Edge Code, Brackets, let alone PDF and Photoshop


7. Why do you want to work at Adobe?
you know, Adobe is on the list of most admire companies every year. I want to be part of a company that offers no less than quality in terms of products and after sales services. I am are truly passionate about the work adobe provide.and I really like Adobe's company culture ,I notice that the culture said throughout Adobe you will  find a culture of creativity, collaboration, and community. Adobe careers combine challenging job responsibilities, professional development opportunities, support for community involvement, and chances to connect with co-workers so all of the thing it's pretty fit my values.  And you know I like  many Adobe products, like Edge Code, Brackets, let alone PDF and Photoshopthat’s why I want to work at Adobe

8. why do you chose the position?
You know I am have many years experience in software development field,so I love technology and problem solving, I  have a passion for breaking things and putting them back together, and I also want to be a  full-stack web developer, above all is pretty according with this position’s requirement, and I really want to work for adobe, that’s why I chose this position

9.Whe can you work

My opt start from eighteen April, but I can work anytime as company need,

10. Question 

  • What is the best part of working for adobe?
  • What are biggest challenges of this job?
  • what type of background do you feel would be best suited for this position?
  • What do you think about Lehi?

1. Self-introduction

My name is  Zhengbin and you can call me Robin, I got my bachelor degree   computer science and previous master degree information security in beijing jiaotong university in China. Now I am  a graduate student from Santa clara university, majored in computer science and engineering. My currently concentration is web development and I am also solid in Java programming. My graduate time is in march this year.Opt start from eighteen April.

What’s more, I am self-motivated and enjoy working in a team environment. I am also a hard worker.I’m looking for an opportunity to work for a great company where I can contribute my hands-on experience and grow my career with the company. That’s it

2. About project 

1. Vending Machine Project is  the most impressive project I’va ever done

I developed a Vending Machine Background Web Site. It’s a online vending machine system, which has two main part, the first part which  we used a android cell-phone to act as a vending machine, we can buy item by phone.

The second part is a background website, that is what I do,It is used to allow employee to register and login,  Employees work on each vending machine to register the machine, add or delete item from machine and refill machine when it needed.  The Monitoring website is also able to get all the statistics, including items, machine and sales information.

The fronted end use bootstrap jQuery and ejs template,

 the backend is written in a Nodejs,and using node framework expressjs 


The difficult part is the integration part since there are a lot of modules working together. For example ,the backend website, the frontend android client and the communication server.To conquer it, I read a lot of helper document and talk with my group member for many times. The other difficult part of my project is that I am totally new to it meanwhile few people in our team have experience in it, To conquer it, I tried to find some similar implementation online and finally finish it. When the web site finished, I am so proud of it.’


3.About work

1.

In this work, I am a student research assistant  ,you konw my major is information security and the work is more relate to security. during that time, I am  focusing on the existing remote authentication scheme based on biological characteristics, like finger print and palmprint. At my work I also analyzed the safety defects of different biometirc security system, then develop  a new blind identity authentication scheme based on palmprint. The scheme can effectively solve issues on user privacy, template protection and trust. 

2.

NEC Software Technology   ,                                                                                                                                               

In this work, I Software Engineer Intern

Redeveloped the  back-end for trading system at Japan-based bank.

·             Involved the development of a management system in using SSH framework

·             Implemented part of management database and web service.

Built user management application for supply chain system that is used externally by suppliers. It is a user friendly, Single-Page web application with real-time performance for editing, creating, listing and paging.

3.PetBnB Website

·             A online websit used to assist people with finding pet sitters when in need. 

Front end: Angular.js, bootstrape,

Backend: A PHP framework Laravel

·              My responseble is mainly focus on  implemented the  front-end design to include a pet-hoster detailed page,  showing result lists with Google Map API. For example when we search some kinds of dogs, then the google map will show some pets which meet the requirement, when you click the icon on the map, then will jump to  details page, and you can see a pet list, it provide the dogs’ information hoster information, price, and so on.

 2.Weather Web Application 

At first we just complete a static page, 

·             Created mocked-up iOS weather app UI with client side validations. 

·             and then  we Implemented by using Ember.js and AJAX in order to achieve functions of search cites as well as add and delete.

4.Frugal Innovation Lab Application Class Project

·             Designed a management system used by people who are undertaking the initiation of project.

·             Implemented the MVC architectrue, by using Swing for ui, database using MySQL with the Java Persistence API
